SENT.plain: The authors present a rare case of ventriculitis secondary to cerebro spinal fluid (CSF) colonization with Escherichia coli species in a 65-year-old woman
Passage of bacterial organisms from the lumen of the gastrointestinal tract to the bloodstream or lymphatic tissue is known as translocation
Once in the bloodstream, particular bacteria are able to cross the blood-brain barrier and migrate to CSF
Elective abdominal surgery, intestinal obstruction, colorectal cancer, ischaemic reperfusion injury and pancreatitis have all increased the risk of this phenomenon
This account highlights particular events in presentation and management of such a case, followed by a brief literature review
